title: College Library
body:
A Gateway to Knowledge

The Central Library at Amer Maharaja P.G. College is the academic heart of our institution. As we move through the 2026 academic year, the library has evolved into a hybrid learning center, blending an extensive physical collection with modern digital resources. Our mission is to provide an environment that encourages deep research and independent study for both students and faculty.

Our Resources

  • Physical Collection: Over 15,000 books covering Arts, Science, Commerce, and competitive examinations.
  • Digital Library: Access to e-journals, research databases, and the National Digital Library (NDL).
  • Reading Rooms: Spacious, well-lit, and quiet areas designed for focused learning.
  • Reference Section: Rare manuscripts, encyclopedias, and current affairs periodicals updated weekly.

Modern Facilities

We have implemented a fully automated Library Management System for seamless book issuance and tracking. Students can access the Online Public Access Catalog (OPAC) to check book availability from anywhere on campus. Additionally, we provide dedicated computer terminals for browsing academic e-content and printing facilities for research papers.

Library Ethics

We maintain a strict code of silence and discipline to ensure a productive atmosphere. Our dedicated librarians are always available to assist students in finding the right resources for their projects and academic inquiries.
